line_2: And strong to Second Life.

line_1: Too gross for Life to bear;
line_2: I smote — and GOD was there!

line_1: To glorify thy Name;
line_2: And suffer All my Shame.

line_1: And suffer All my Shame.

line_2: His Name, Reproach and Praise, was Man.

line_1: Did no great Deeds adorn his Course?
line_2: No Deed of His, but shew'd him worse:

line_1: No Deed of His, but shew'd him worse:

line_1: One Thing was great, which GOD supply'd,
line_2: He suffer'd Human Life — and Dy'd.

line_1: He suffer'd Human Life — and Dy'd.

line_2: That Life was sacred all — and Vain:

line_1: Sacred how high, and vain how low?
line_2: He knew not here, but dy'd to know.

line_2: And point the Steps mysterious as they lie;

line_2: Above Self-seeking blest, on GOD reclin'd,

line_2: Nor adds, "Whene'er you find an inward Call."

line_2: And kindle, till you catch the Gospel-Fire.

line_1: And ransack'd Nature furnishes the Feast.
line_2: Air, Earth, and Sea conspire to tempt her Taste,

line_1: Life's gaudiest Pride attracts her willing Eyes,
line_2: And Balls, and Theaters, and Courts arise:

line_1: And Balls, and Theaters, and Courts arise:
line_2: Life's gaudiest Pride attracts her willing Eyes,

line_1: Italian Songsters pant her Ear to please,
line_2: Bid the first Cries of infant Reason cease,

line_1: Italian Songsters pant her Ear to please,
line_2: Save her from Thought, and lull her Soul to Peace.

line_1: Bid the first Cries of infant Reason cease,
line_2: Italian Songsters pant her Ear to please,

line_1: Bid the first Cries of infant Reason cease,
line_2: Save her from Thought, and lull her Soul to Peace.

line_1: Save her from Thought, and lull her Soul to Peace.
line_2: Italian Songsters pant her Ear to please,

line_1: Save her from Thought, and lull her Soul to Peace.
line_2: Bid the first Cries of infant Reason cease,

line_1: Deep sunk in Sense th' imprison'd Soul remains,
line_2: Nor knows its Fall from GOD, nor feels its Chains:

line_1: Nor knows its Fall from GOD, nor feels its Chains:
line_2: Deep sunk in Sense th' imprison'd Soul remains,

line_1: Unconscious still, sleeps on in Error's Night,
line_2: Nor strives to rise, nor struggles into Light:

line_1: Nor strives to rise, nor struggles into Light:
line_2: Unconscious still, sleeps on in Error's Night,

line_1: Heav'n-born in vain, degen'rate cleaves to Earth,
line_2: (No Pangs experienc'd of the Second Birth)

line_1: (No Pangs experienc'd of the Second Birth)
line_2: Heav'n-born in vain, degen'rate cleaves to Earth,

line_1: She only Faln, yet Unawaken'd found,
line_2: While All th' enthrall'd Creation groans around.

line_1: While All th' enthrall'd Creation groans around.
line_2: She only Faln, yet Unawaken'd found,

line_1: ACCEPT, dear Youth, a sympathizing Lay,
line_2: The only Tribute pitying Love can pay.

line_1: The only Tribute pitying Love can pay.
line_2: ACCEPT, dear Youth, a sympathizing Lay,

line_1: Tho' vain the Hope thine Anguish to asswage,
line_2: Charm down Desire, or calm fierce Passion's Rage;

line_1: Charm down Desire, or calm fierce Passion's Rage;
line_2: Tho' vain the Hope thine Anguish to asswage,

line_1: Yet still permit me in thy Griefs to grieve,
line_2: Relief to offer, if I can't relieve;

line_1: Relief to offer, if I can't relieve;
line_2: Yet still permit me in thy Griefs to grieve,

line_1: Near thy sick Couch with fond Concern t' attend,
line_2: And reach out Cordials to my Dying Friend.

line_1: And reach out Cordials to my Dying Friend.
line_2: Near thy sick Couch with fond Concern t' attend,

line_1: Poor hapless Youth! what Words can ease thy Pain,
line_2: When Reason pleads, and Wisdom cries in vain!

line_1: When Reason pleads, and Wisdom cries in vain!
line_2: Poor hapless Youth! what Words can ease thy Pain,

line_1: Can feeble Verse impetuous Nature guide,
line_2: Or stem the Force of blind Affection's Tide?

line_1: Or stem the Force of blind Affection's Tide?
line_2: Can feeble Verse impetuous Nature guide,

line_1: If Reason checks, or Duty disallows,
line_2: "Reason, you cry, and Duty are my Foes:

line_1: "Reason, you cry, and Duty are my Foes:
line_2: If Reason checks, or Duty disallows,

line_1: " Religion's Dictates ineffectual prove,
line_2: "And GOD Himself's Impertinence in Love.

line_1: "And GOD Himself's Impertinence in Love.
line_2: " Religion's Dictates ineffectual prove,

line_1: What art Thou, Love? Thou strange mysterious Ill,
line_2: Whom none aright can know, tho' all can seel.

line_1: Whom none aright can know, tho' all can seel.
line_2: What art Thou, Love? Thou strange mysterious Ill,

line_1: From careless Sloth thy dull Existence flows,
line_2: And feeds the Fountain whence itself arose:

line_1: And feeds the Fountain whence itself arose:
line_2: From careless Sloth thy dull Existence flows,

line_1: Silent its Waves with baleful Influence roll,
line_2: Damp the young Mind, and sink th' aspiring Soul

line_1: Damp the young Mind, and sink th' aspiring Soul
line_2: Silent its Waves with baleful Influence roll,

line_1: Poison its Virtues, all its Pow'rs restrain,
line_2: And blast the Promise of the future Man.

line_1: And blast the Promise of the future Man.
line_2: Poison its Virtues, all its Pow'rs restrain,

line_1: To Thee, curst Fiend, the captive Wretch consign'd,
line_2: "His Passions rampant, and his Reason blind,

line_1: "His Passions rampant, and his Reason blind,
line_2: To Thee, curst Fiend, the captive Wretch consign'd,

line_1: Reason, Heav'n's great Vicegerent, dares disown,
line_2: And place a Foolish Idol in its Throne:

line_1: And place a Foolish Idol in its Throne:
line_2: Reason, Heav'n's great Vicegerent, dares disown,

line_1: Or wildly raise his frantic Raptures higher,
line_2: And pour out Blasphemies at thy Desire.

line_1: And pour out Blasphemies at thy Desire.
line_2: Or wildly raise his frantic Raptures higher,

line_1: At thy Desire he bids a Creature shine,
line_2: He decks a Worm with Attributes Divine;

line_1: He decks a Worm with Attributes Divine;
line_2: At thy Desire he bids a Creature shine,

line_1: Hers to Angelic Beauties dares prefer,
line_2: " Angels are painted fair to look like Her!

line_1: " Angels are painted fair to look like Her!
line_2: Hers to Angelic Beauties dares prefer,

line_1: Before her Shrine the lowly Suppliant laid,
line_2: Adores the Idol that Himself has made:

line_1: Adores the Idol that Himself has made:
line_2: Before her Shrine the lowly Suppliant laid,

line_1: From her Almighty Breath his Doom receives,
line_2: Dies by her Frown, as by her Smile he lives.

line_1: Dies by her Frown, as by her Smile he lives.
line_2: From her Almighty Breath his Doom receives,

line_1: Supreme she reigns in all-sufficient State,
line_2: To her he bows, from her expects his Fate,

line_1: Supreme she reigns in all-sufficient State,
line_2: "Heav'n in her Love, Damnation in her Hate.

line_1: To her he bows, from her expects his Fate,
line_2: Supreme she reigns in all-sufficient State,

line_1: To her he bows, from her expects his Fate,
line_2: "Heav'n in her Love, Damnation in her Hate.

line_1: "Heav'n in her Love, Damnation in her Hate.
line_2: Supreme she reigns in all-sufficient State,

line_1: "Heav'n in her Love, Damnation in her Hate.
line_2: To her he bows, from her expects his Fate,

line_1: He rears unhallow'd Altars to her Name,
line_2: Where Lust lights up a black, polluted Flame;

line_1: Where Lust lights up a black, polluted Flame;
line_2: He rears unhallow'd Altars to her Name,

line_1: Where Sighs impure, as impious Incense rise,
line_2: Himself the Priest, his Heart the Sacrifice:

line_1: Where Sighs impure, as impious Incense rise,
line_2: And thus GOD's Sacred Word his Horrid Pray'r supplies.

line_1: Himself the Priest, his Heart the Sacrifice:
line_2: Where Sighs impure, as impious Incense rise,

line_1: Himself the Priest, his Heart the Sacrifice:
line_2: And thus GOD's Sacred Word his Horrid Pray'r supplies.

line_1: And thus GOD's Sacred Word his Horrid Pray'r supplies.
line_2: Where Sighs impure, as impious Incense rise,

line_1: And thus GOD's Sacred Word his Horrid Pray'r supplies.
line_2: Himself the Priest, his Heart the Sacrifice:

line_1: "Center of All Perfection, Source of Bliss,
line_2: " In whom thy Creature lives and moves and is,

line_1: " In whom thy Creature lives and moves and is,
line_2: "Center of All Perfection, Source of Bliss,

line_1: "Save, or I perish! hear my humble Pray'r,
line_2: " Spare thy poor Servant — O in Mercy spare.

line_1: " Spare thy poor Servant — O in Mercy spare.
line_2: "Save, or I perish! hear my humble Pray'r,

line_1: "Thou art my Joy, on Thee depends my Trust,
line_2: " Hide not thy Face, nor frown me into Dust.

line_1: " Hide not thy Face, nor frown me into Dust.
line_2: "Thou art my Joy, on Thee depends my Trust,

line_1: "Send forth thy Breath, and rais'd again I see
line_2: " My Joy, my Life, my Final Bliss in Thee.

line_1: " My Joy, my Life, my Final Bliss in Thee.
line_2: "Send forth thy Breath, and rais'd again I see

line_1: "For Thee I Am: for Thee I All resign,
line_2: " Be Thou my One thing Needful, Ever Mine!

line_1: " Be Thou my One thing Needful, Ever Mine!
line_2: "For Thee I Am: for Thee I All resign,

line_1: But O forbear, presumptuous Muse forbear,
line_2: Nor wound with Rant profane the Christian Ear:

line_1: Nor wound with Rant profane the Christian Ear:
line_2: But O forbear, presumptuous Muse forbear,

line_1: A just Abhorrence in my Friend I see,
line_2: He starts from Love, when Love's Idolatry.

line_1: He starts from Love, when Love's Idolatry.
line_2: A just Abhorrence in my Friend I see,

line_1: "Give me thy Heart," if the Creator cries,
line_2: "'Tis giv'n the Creature," What bold Wretch replies?

line_1: "'Tis giv'n the Creature," What bold Wretch replies?
line_2: "Give me thy Heart," if the Creator cries,

line_1: Not so my Friend — he wakes, he breaths again,
line_2: And "Reason takes once more the slacken'd Rein."

line_1: And "Reason takes once more the slacken'd Rein."
line_2: Not so my Friend — he wakes, he breaths again,

line_1: In vain rebellious Nature claims a Part,
line_2: When Heav'n requires, he gives up All his Heart:

line_1: When Heav'n requires, he gives up All his Heart:
line_2: In vain rebellious Nature claims a Part,

line_1: ( "For Love Divine no Partnership allows,
line_2: " And Heav'n averse rejects divided Vows)

line_1: " And Heav'n averse rejects divided Vows)
line_2: ( "For Love Divine no Partnership allows,

line_1: Fixt tho' she be, he rends the Idol thence,
line_2: Nor lets her Pow'r exceed Omnipotence.

line_1: Nor lets her Pow'r exceed Omnipotence.
line_2: Fixt tho' she be, he rends the Idol thence,

line_1: Commands his GOD, "Cut off th' offending Hand?"
line_2: He hears, Obedient to his GOD's Command:

line_1: He hears, Obedient to his GOD's Command:
line_2: Commands his GOD, "Cut off th' offending Hand?"

line_1: "Pluck out thine Eye," let the Redeemer say;
line_2: He tears, and casts the bleeding Orb away.

line_1: He tears, and casts the bleeding Orb away.
line_2: "Pluck out thine Eye," let the Redeemer say;

line_1: Victorious now to Nobler Joys aspires,
line_2: His Bosom, touch'd with more than Earthly Fires:

line_1: His Bosom, touch'd with more than Earthly Fires:
line_2: Victorious now to Nobler Joys aspires,

line_1: He leaves rough Passion for calm Virtue's Road,
line_2: Gives Earth for Heav'n, and quits a Worm for GOD.

line_1: Gives Earth for Heav'n, and quits a Worm for GOD.
line_2: He leaves rough Passion for calm Virtue's Road,

line_1: INstructive Sound! I'm now convinc'd by Thee
line_2: Time in its Womb may bear Infinity.

line_1: Time in its Womb may bear Infinity.
line_2: INstructive Sound! I'm now convinc'd by Thee

line_1: How the past Moment dies, and throbs no more!
line_2: What Worlds of Parts compose the rolling Hour!

line_1: What Worlds of Parts compose the rolling Hour!
line_2: How the past Moment dies, and throbs no more!

line_1: The least of these a serious Care demands;
line_2: For tho' they're little, yet they're Golden Sands:

line_1: For tho' they're little, yet they're Golden Sands:
line_2: The least of these a serious Care demands;

line_1: By some great Deeds distinguish'd all in Heav'n,
line_2: For the same End to me by Number giv'n!

line_1: For the same End to me by Number giv'n!
line_2: By some great Deeds distinguish'd all in Heav'n,

line_1: Cease, Man, to lavish Sums thou ne'er hast told!
line_2: Angels, tho' Deathless, dare not be so bold!

line_1: Angels, tho' Deathless, dare not be so bold!
line_2: Cease, Man, to lavish Sums thou ne'er hast told!

line_1: Of Holiness is seen:
line_2: What Deserts lie between?

line_1: What Deserts lie between?
line_2: Of Holiness is seen:

line_1: What will it cost to break;
line_2: No more within him speak?

line_1: No more within him speak?
line_2: What will it cost to break;

line_1: The Root of Nature's Joy?
line_2: The Pride of Heart destroy?

line_1: The Pride of Heart destroy?
line_2: The Root of Nature's Joy?

line_1: In Stilness to sustain;
line_2: Whom GOD has doom'd to Pain.

line_1: Whom GOD has doom'd to Pain.
line_2: In Stilness to sustain;

line_1: Now Stupor shall distress;
line_2: Wild Images impress.

line_1: Wild Images impress.
line_2: Now Stupor shall distress;

line_1: His Arm still onward bears,
line_2: A Peace beneath appears.

line_1: A Peace beneath appears.
line_2: His Arm still onward bears,

line_1: By Instincts from above;
line_2: And mystic Pow'rs of Love.

line_1: And mystic Pow'rs of Love.
line_2: By Instincts from above;

line_1: Of Ghostly Gifts to shine:
line_2: And decent Griefs are Thine.

line_1: And decent Griefs are Thine.
line_2: Of Ghostly Gifts to shine:
